citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water Quality
citeinfo.title: NPDES_PIPE_IDEM_IN: Pipe Locations in the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System in Indiana (Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Point Shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water Quality

citeinfo.othercit:
This data set was provided to personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) by Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water Quality personnel on December 12, 2002. The data set provided was in an ESRI shapefile format, and was named "A-NPDES-PIPE."
It was subsequently updated on October 8, 2013 by IDEM OLQ personnel, and was provided as an ESRI geodatabase point feature class named "ICIS_PIPES."

descript.abstract:
NPDES_PIPE_IDEM_IN is a point shapefile that contains National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) Program pipe locations in Indiana, provided by personnel of Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water Quality (IDEM, OWQ) as of October 8, 2013. The most recent update provided by IDEM was an ESRI point feature class named "ICIS_PIPES." NPDES_PIPE_IDEM_IN is attributed with facility name, contact information, and addresses. Facility information and locational coordinates were obtained by IDEM from the Environnmental Protection Agency (EPA) Integrated Compliance Information System (ICIS) database (website location: http://www.epa.gov/compliance/data/systems/icis/).
NOTE: The original feature class named "ICIS_PIPES" provided by IDEM contains many attribute records that do not contain location and coordinate system information. There are a total of 10,187 attribute records provided in this data layer. Of those, a total of only 5,999 records contain locational information and are displayed in a spatial map view. The remaining 4,188 records have been retained in the attribute table to aid users of these data in performing environmental accessments in the state of Indiana.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OWQ for the source feature class ICIS_PIPES:
"This database is extracted from the national EPA Integrated Compliance Information System (ICIS) database and includes all available records listed in Indiana associated with "Active" surface water discharges. It consists of primarily of state permitted and regulated wastewater facility related information. The files are point locations and are projected into a UTM NAD83 zone 16 North coordinate system. Facility name, contacts, and a variety of mailing addresses are included for each permit along with locational data as available. Additionally, records for Stormwater permits under Rule 6, stormwater associated with industrial activities, have been appended into the tables.
The data set provides an important map layer for the Indiana Department of Environmental Management staff in conducting environmental assessments as well as a direct source or contact and mailing information. Although the database record set depicts all available information on regulated wastewater discharge sites as of the date of extraction, the locational and coordinate information is not complete, therefore queries and other searches are best handled through the attribute tables rather than from visually on maps where not all sites are represented."
descript.purpose: This data set was developed to provide accurate coordinate information for employees and customers of the Indiana Department of Environmental Management to conduct environmental assessments and to obtain locations and contact information for permitted and regulated wastewater discharge pipes and associated facilities in Indiana.
descript.supplinf:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OWQ for the previously published source shapefile A-NPDES-PIPE:
"This subset of the Permit Compliance System database focuses in on "active" state regulated wastewater facility permit discharge points discharging into surface water bodies under the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System program. It does include both "active" and "inactive" pipes for those actively permitted sites. Point locations generally reflect the sampling site which most often is where the discharge enters a surface water body but may reflect a manhole or other sample point. Records for which there are locational coordinates have mostly been collected using 5 meter mapping grade GPS field units. Other locational coordinates have been either map interpolated from USGS 1:24,000 topographical quadrangle maps or were provided as unverified numeric information by the regulated facility or it's representative. For more information about locational accuracy see the field 'Latitude/Longitude Method'."

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS version 10.2 shapefile format, approximately XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX Mb

attracc.attraccr: This data set was provided by IDEM OWQ personnel. IDEM OWQ personnel downloaded the data found in the source feature class named "ICIS_PIPES" from the Environnmental Protection Agency (EPA) Integrated Compliance Information System (ICIS) database (website location: http://www.epa.gov/compliance/data/systems/icis/). This data has been compiled for many years from many different sources. Therefore various levels of qualitative accuracy are present in this data set.

dataqual.logic: This data set was provided by IDEM personnel and is assumed to be as accurate as the data stored on the Environnmental Protection Agency (EPA) Integrated Compliance Information System (ICIS) database (website location: http://www.epa.gov/compliance/data/systems/icis/).
dataqual.complete: This data set consists of pipe locations and facilities contained within the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) within the state of Indiana. This data set is incomplete and personnel at a time previous to publication. However the data set may be incomplete and/or inaccurate due to the ever-changing status of managed facilities and sites, and due to the data collection and processing efforts of IDEM staff. It is an ever-changing work in progress.

horizpa.horizpar:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OWQ for the source feature class ICIS_PIPES:
"This data has been compiled over a long period of time using a wide range of sources. Recent efforts have centered on using GPS mapping grade units to collect accurate locations at approximately +/- 5 meters. Other records have been either map interpolated from 1:24,000 USGS topographical quadrangle maps or still reflect coordinate values provided by outside sources of unknown accuracy."

vertacc.vertaccr:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OWQ for the source feature class ICIS_PIPES:
"No attempt to collect or maintain vertical information on these sites at this time."

citeinfo.title: ICIS_PIPES (ESRI file geodatabase point feature class)
citeinfo.othercit: IGS personnel requested locational information for various environmental GIS data in Indiana from IDEM, OWQ personnel. Kevin Miller (IDEM, OLQ) provided a CD-ROM that contained the shapefile A-NPDES-FACILITY.SHP. E.J. McNaughton (IDEM OLQ) subsequently provided an update for these data to IGS personnel on October 08, 2013, as an ESRI file geodatabase point feature class named "ICIS_PIPES."

srcinfo.typesrc: ESRI file geodatabase point feature class

srctime.srccurr: Based on metadata provided by IDEM, OWQ for the source feature class ICIS_PIPES.

srcinfo.srccitea: ICIS_PIPES (ESRI file geodatabase point feature class)
srcinfo.srccontr: Pipe Locations in the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) in Indiana

procstep.procdesc: Field inspectors were trained in the use of Trimble Inc. GeoExplorer 2 hand-held mapping grade GPS equipment by an in-house trainer to ensure consistancy in data collection and processing techniques. All units use a standardized Data Dictionary (feature attribute tables) to collect coordinates during routine inspection trips. Field files are then sent to the office for post-processing by one individual and incorporated into MicroSoft Access data tables.
procstep.srcused: GPS field data, NPDES permits, permit applications, correspondence, USGS Topo maps, etc.

procstep.procdesc: MS Access database tables composed of individual GPS records for point locations associated with NPDES permitted facilities and outfalls are checked for proper ID values matching known permits, any edit changes to data records are made, and then coordinate values in degrees, minutes, seconds are calculated. Records are evaluated to see if they meet the requirements for input into the EPA mainframe system.

Locational coordinates and all other field data are hand entered into the EPA mainframe computer database system titled the Permit Compliance System (PCS) in Raliegh, NC. Fields are checked and updated whenever new information becomes available.

PCS database records are downloaded via ASCII undelimited text files and imported into a MS Access 97 database. Coordinate data is converted back to decimal degrees and then original GPS coordinates overwrite those calculated values were appropriate. Also field collection metadata fields are added to the data tables and data appended from field tables where available.

Access database tables are exported into generic DBase table format then added to ESRI ArcGIS map software. The tables are used to create map feature shapefiles from the coordinate information. The files are finally saved as point shapefiles in the ArcGIS format and metadata added.

IGS personnel received an ESRI point shapefile named A-NPDES-PIPE from IDEM personnel on December 12, 2002. A-NPDES-PIPE was loaded into ESRI ArcView 3.3 and the following columns were deleted from the associated attribute table: PIPE_ACTIV, PNORTHING, PLAT_D, PLAT_M, PLAT_S, PLAT_DS, PEASTING, PLON_D, PLON_M, PLON_S, PLON_DS, PLL_METHOD, PLAT_DD, PLON_DD, LGNDSORT, LGNDPTYPEM, NORTHING, EASTING, POS, STND_DEV, and HORIZ_PREC. The shapefile was also visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary.
NOTE: 2781 points were deleted from the A-NPDES-PIPE.DBF because there were no associated UTM values represented in the shapefile. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as NPDES_PIPE_IDEM_IN.
It should also be noted that portions of the associated metadata provided by IDEM for A-NPDES-PIPE was extracted and included in this metadata file.

IGS personnel received an ESRI file geodatabase point feature class named "ICIS_PIPES" from IDEM personnel on October 8, 2013. ICIS_PIPES was loaded into ESRI ArcMap 10.2 to be visually inspected to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the state boundary of Indiana. The following attribute fields were deleted from the associated attribute table: PERMFEATUR, PERMFEAT_1, HORIZACCUR, .
NOTE: There are a total of 10,187 attribute records provided in this data layer. Of those, a total of only 5,999 records contain locational information and are displayed in a spatial map view. It should also be noted that portions of the associated metadata provided by IDEM for ICIS_PIPES were extracted and included in this metadata file.
procstep.srcused: ICIS_PIPES (ESRI file geodatabase point feature class)

procstep.procdesc: This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Identification number for individual records, composed of a two character state id, a one character permit code and a 6 digit number
Name of the facility for which the permit is issued
Single character code categorizing the discharge point. Also is the last character of the outfall ID number.
Description and notes collected by IDEM personnel during site visits
Status of the discharge point (either "Active" or "Inactive")
Date in which the discharge point became legally active under the most recent permit
Date when the pipe was declared legally inactive and unable to discharge any further (closed or Plugged
Type of permitted discharge point ("External Outfall," "Influent Structure," "Intake Structure," "Internal Outfall, "Land Application Site," or "Other")
Locational value of Latitude for the discharge point (units are Decimal Degrees, coordinate system unknown)
Locational value of Longitude for the discharge point (units are Decimal Degrees, coordinate system unknown)
Description of the method used to collect the locational information of the discharge point
8 digit USGS and EPA stream basin code system
ID for the RAD reach, comprised of the 8 digit USGS and EPA stream basin code and a 6 digit ID value
Description or accepted name of the water body (river, stream, lake, etc.) that recieves the discharge from the discharge point

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water Quality be cited in any products generated from this data set. The following source citation should be included: [NPDES_PIPE_IDEM_IN: Pipe Locations in the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System in Indiana (Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Point Shapefile), 2013]
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the originally provided source shapefile A-NPDES-PIPE:

THE RECIPIENT, OF THE DATA, SOFTWARE, INFORMATION OR SERVICES, ACKNOWLEDGES AND AGREES THAT IT HAS RECEIVED ADEQUATE NOTICE THAT USE OF THE DATA, SOFTWARE, INFORMATION OR SERVICES IS AT RECIPIENTS OWN RISK.
IDEM AND OR ITS RESPECTIVE SUPPLIERS HEREBY DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES AND CONDITIONS WITH REGARD TO THE AFOREMENTIONED MATERIAL, INCLUDING WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, TITLE, NONINFRINGEMENT, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, LACK OF VIRUSES, ACCURACY OR COMPLETENESS OF RESPONSES, RESULTS, LACK OF NEGLIGENCE OR LACK OF WORKMANLIKE EFFORT, QUIET ENJOYMENT, QUIET POSSESSION, AND CORRESPONDENCE TO DESCRIPTION. FURTHER THE ABOVE LIST OF DISCLAIMED WARRANTIES IS NOT EXHAUSTIVE AS ANY AND ALL WARRANTIES AND CONDITIONS ARE DISCLAIMED. THE ENTIRE RISK ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF OR PERFORMANCE OF THE DATA, SOFTWARE, INFORMATION OR SERVICES IS BORNE BY THE RECIPIENT.
EXCLUSION OF INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL AND CERTAIN OTHER DAMAGES.
TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN NO EVENT SHALL IDEM OR ITS SUPPLIERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, INDIRECT OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES WHATSOEVER, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DAMAGES FOR: LOSS OF PROFITS, LOSS OF CONFIDENTIAL OR OTHER INFORMATION, BUSINESS INTERRUPTION, PERSONAL INJURY, LOSS OF PRIVACY, FAILURE TO MEET ANY DUTY (INCLUDING GOOD FAITH AND REASONABLE CARE), NEGLIGENCE, AND ANY OTHER PECUNIARY OR OTHER LOSS WHATSOEVER, ARISING OUT OF OR IN ANY WAY RELATED TO THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE, THE DATA, SOFTWARE, INFORMATION OR SERVICES, EVEN IF THE RECIPIENT IS ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. RECIPIENT'S SOLE REMEDY IS TO DISCONTINUE THE USE OF THE DATA, SOFTWARE, INFORMATION OR SERVICES."

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
